title: Pre-Harry Potter & the GoF Movie
content:
How good do you think this movie will be?

I really doubt they will be able to do a very good job due to the imensity of the book. I dunno, I never liked the movies that much, Harry Potter was meant to be shown through the medium of words, not acting and special effects...

Thoughts?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Pre-Harry Potter & the GoF Movie
content:
For the third movie they got rid of the previous director and replaced him with Alfonso Cuaron. That might have helped the movie a bit.

[url=http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0190859/]www.imdb.com/name/nm0190859/[/url]

Looks like he picked up some jobs after that gig ><

Now it's directed by Mike Newell.

[url=http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0001565/]www.imdb.com/name/nm0001565/[/url]

He's done a few good movies but I don't recognize most of it. Funny though, I did notice something called [url=http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0007YMWGY/103-3627946-4966256?v=glance&n=130&v=glance]Baa Baa Black Sheep[/url], some T.V. show about WW2. And it stands out in my mind so much BECAUSE IN KINDERGARTEN my FRIEND RAVED about the show. ...

Yeah, don't ask don't tell.[img]http://img447.imageshack.us/img447/4808/dimesterrulez24aa.gif[/img]

title: Re: Pre-Harry Potter & the GoF Movie
content:
I'm having mixed feelings about the movie. Yeah sure its getting some good reviews and the trailers do look intense but the 3rd movie cut some important subplots from the book (i.e. concerning James and sirus's past) and with GoF being a huge book I do have my doubts. Well I'm seeing it on opening day with my friends anyways so I'll be sure to post my review once I get back (and play some Shadow the Hedgehog when I get it too [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] )Check out my blog at [url=http://spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/]spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/[/url]

title: Re: Pre-Harry Potter & the GoF Movie
content:
I liked the first three books but the fourth and the fifth were long without much happening. The writer is payed by the number of letters... I've never liked the movies, though I've only seen the first two but not the third and fourth. Was there four or only three? I don't even know.

I've read somewhere that hiring a bad director for the first movies and then changing for a better one was intentional, as it's easier to sell the newer movies and say that "it's even better then the previous ones were".[hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Re: Pre-Harry Potter & the GoF Movie
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]
i won't watch this or any other harry potter flims cos they are all for children
[hr][/quote]

I suppose, but I like HP. I really do not care if "it's for kids", because I like it, and I have been on the side of "I don't give a damn what society says"...


At any rate, no, HP1 was the worst, HP3 the next worst, and HP2 was actaully really good. I had extremely high expectations for book 3's conversion into a movie.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Pre-Harry Potter & the GoF Movie
content:
I just came back from seeing it and it was definatly my favorite in the movie series so far. It was definatly darker than the other films and it followed the book ok (they did cut out alot though due to the massive size of the book). I did wish it was longer so it could of kept scenes that i thought should of been in the movie but overall as I fan of the books I enjoyed it.Check out my blog at [url=http://spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/]spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/[/url]
Check out my fanfics at [url=http://www.fanfiction.net/u/680124/]fanfiction.net[/url]

title: Re: Pre-Harry Potter & the GoF Movie
content:
I saw it too. I agree with Superadammario64, and I think that just 5-10 minutes more of stuff could have helped it along. There were some holes in the movie that only get patched up in your mind if you've read the book. Overall, quite good.[hr]

title: Re: Pre-Harry Potter & the GoF Movie
content:
They cut out a lot more than Dobby. The entire deal with Rita Skeeter being an animagus (they're probably figure out some way for Hermione to coerce her to writing Harry's interview in the next book, but it'll probably be lame), Winky, Sirius (revealing himself to Dumbledore, and grudgingly skaking hands with Snape)... Imo, some of the overinflated scenes (e.g. the dragon fight) should've been replaced with actual dialogue from the book that would've made it make more sense. Was I the only one for whom Floo communication was a bit of a dissapointment? That wasn't how I envisioned it at all. An actual head is much better. And that deal with "check if Azkaban is missing any prisoners." WTF is the meaning of that? The plot was entirely screwed up in terms of Crouch.

And why is Hermione so freegin hot? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-potter.gif[/img] [quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote]
